edu.berkeley.compbio.ml.cluster
Class AdditiveCentroidCluster<T extends AdditiveClusterable<T>>

java.lang.Object
  com.davidsoergel.dsutils.LabellableImpl<String>
      edu.berkeley.compbio.ml.cluster.AbstractCluster<T>
          edu.berkeley.compbio.ml.cluster.AbstractCentroidCluster<T>
              edu.berkeley.compbio.ml.cluster.AdditiveCentroidCluster<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.davidsoergel.dsutils.Labellable<String>, CentroidCluster<T>, Cluster<T>, Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BatchAdditiveCentroidCluster
public class AdditiveCentroidCluster<T extends AdditiveClusterable<T>>
extends AbstractCentroidCluster<T>

A cluster whose centroid can be moved by adding or removing individual samples.

Version:
$Id$
Author:
David Soergel

Constructor Detail

AdditiveCentroidCluster

public AdditiveCentroidCluster(int id,
                               T centroid)
Constructs a new AdditiveCluster with the given DistanceMeasure and centroid. Note the centroid may be modified in the course of running a clustering algorithm, so it may not be a good idea to provide a real data point here (i.e., it's probably best to clone it first).

Parameters:
centroid - the T
Method Detail

add

public boolean add(T point)
Add the given sample to this cluster. Does not automatically remove the sample from other clusters of which it is already a member.

Specified by:
add in interface Cluster<T extends AdditiveClusterable<T>>
Overrides:
add in class AbstractCluster<T extends AdditiveClusterable<T>>
Parameters:
point - the sample to add
Returns:
true if the point was successfully added; false otherwise

addAll

public boolean addAll(Cluster<T> otherCluster)
Description copied from class: AbstractCluster
Add all the samples in the given cluster to this cluster. Does not automatically remove the samples from other clusters of which they are already members.

Specified by:
addAll in interface Cluster<T extends AdditiveClusterable<T>>
Overrides:
addAll in class AbstractCluster<T extends AdditiveClusterable<T>>
Parameters:
otherCluster - the sample to add
Returns:

remove

public boolean remove(T point)
Remove the given sample from this cluster.

Specified by:
remove in interface Cluster<T extends AdditiveClusterable<T>>
Overrides:
remove in class AbstractCluster<T extends AdditiveClusterable<T>>
Parameters:
point - the sample to remove
Returns:
true if the point was successfully removed; false otherwise (in particular, if the point is not a member of this cluster in the first place)
